page.title: 02INDUSTRY in THUNDRIDGE
page.content: Mr Max Wright began his company in his mother's hen shed 26 years ago. Today, he is chairman and managing director of Max Wright Ltd. The firm makes oneÂ£off control machines which operate, for example, pumps or freezers. The actual components are sometimes supplied by the company ordering the device or they instruct on the components to be used. Otherwise Max Wrights buy the components themselves and put the device together. The company has supplied control panels to many foreign countries; they have exported to Iran, South America, Belgium, the Falklands and the USA Army stationed in Germany. The firm has tried to supply Libya but this order was frozen after the shooting of the WPC outside the Libyan Embassy in London. Permission has now been given
